How to improve:
- Provide a brief, actionable check procedure, for example:
  - Lock out/tag out power; ensure no backfeed from I/O.
  - Visual inspection: verify PE conductor is landed on the M6 PE studs marked with the earth symbol; no damaged insulation; correct wire gauge; secure lugs; no paint/oxidation under lugs.
  - Mechanical check: torque the PE terminal screws to the manufacturer’s spec.
  - Electrical continuity: use a multimeter to measure resistance between the PE terminal/bus bar and all exposed conductive parts; confirm low resistance (typically ≤0.1–0.2 Ω or per site standard).
  - If required by site procedures, perform an insulation/earth bond test with an earth-bond tester per applicable standards.
  - Re-verify RCD, fuses, and cable routing before re-energizing.

- The student’s answer is concise and on-topic by listing protocols; however, its accuracy relative to “real-time control” is problematic.
